meanings.definition: In a circular or spiral manner.
meanings.sent1: The vines grew circinately around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: She danced circinately around the room, twirling gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail circinately, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts spiraled circinately, leading her to a new idea.
meanings.sent5: The wind blew circinately, creating a whirlwind of leaves.

meanings.definition: Coiled or rolled up in a spiral shape.
meanings.sent1: The circinately wrapped rope held the boat securely in place.
meanings.sent2: He admired the circinately patterned shell of the snail.
meanings.sent3: The circinately curled fern reminded her of a spring.
meanings.sent4: Her circinately braided hair looked intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The circinately designed staircase spiraled elegantly up the tower.
